title: Rab and His Friends and Other Papers
author: Brown, John
snippet: As we passed through Slateford, he spoke of Dr. Belfrage, his great-hearted friend, of his obligations to him, and of his son, my friend, both lying together in Colinton churchyard; and of Dr. Dick, who was minister before him, of the Coventrys, and of Stitchel and Sprouston, of his mother, and of himself,--his doubts of his own sincerity in religion, his sense of sin, of God--reverting often to his dying friend.

title: My first visit to Europe:
author: Dickinson, Andrew
snippet: From Kelso to Sprouston, on the banks of the Tweed, it is two miles, by coach.
